words.definition: to tell commonly that something is true or allow it
words.example: I accepted the girl's very nice gift.

words.definition: to put things in the right place
words.example: Please arrange the bowling pins in order so we can play.

words.definition: to go to an event such as a meeting or a class
words.example: My sister and I attend the same school.

words.definition: to be in a position where you do not fall to either side
words.example: We saw an elephant balance itself on a ball.

words.definition: the sharp difference between two things
words.example: The contrast between my parents' hair colors is very noticeable.

words.definition: to make someone want to do something
words.example: My football coach will encourage us when we are losing.

words.definition: well known because you have seen or heard it before
words.example: The world map is familiar to most people.

words.definition: to take a hold of something suddenly or rudely
words.example: I grabbed a pear from the tree.

words.definition: to keep something above the ground
words.example: I drew a picture of my family, and my mother hung it on the wall.

words.definition: very big
words.example: At work, my father drives a huge truck.

words.definition: needed to complete something
words.example: It is necessary to have a passport when you travel to another country.

words.definition: a way in which something is done or organized
words.example: My nephew's birthday cake had a pattern of stars on it.

words.definition: to suggest a plan or an action
words.example: Santa Claus proposed that we help him with the gifts.

words.definition: the reason that you do something
words.example: The purpose of exercising is to get into shape.

words.definition: to stop holding someone or something
words.example: She released the bird from her hands.

words.definition: to say that something is necessary
words.example: We require teachers to have a university degree.

words.definition: only one
words.example: I have a single key in my hand.

words.definition: the achievement of a goal or purpose
words.example: My stained glass project was a huge success.

words.definition: to pull something apart
words.example: It is easy to tear paper.

words.definition: an idea about how something works
words.example: We talked about Einstein's theory of relativity in class.
